revised_title: Magnetoresistance in Silver and Copper: Investigating Electron Scattering
tldr: The authors measured longitudinal magnetoresistance in silver and copper crystals to study the effects of different types of electron scattering, particularly small-angle scattering. They found that impure crystals follow the relaxation time approximation, while purified crystals do not. The results suggest that longitudinal magnetoresistance can be used to detect the presence of diffusive scattering and provide insights into the form of electron scattering in metals.
